citation.article-title: Novel members of the family Flavobacteriaceae from Antarctic maritime habitats including Subsaximicrobium wynnwilliamsii gen. nov., sp. nov., Subsaximicrobium saxinquilinus sp. nov., Subsaxibacter broadyi gen. nov., sp. nov., Lacinutrix copepodicola gen. nov., sp. nov., and novel species of the genera Bizionia, Gelidibacter and Gillisia
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Lacinutrix [La.ci.nu′trix. L. n. lacus lake; L. fem. n. nutrix feeder; N.L. fem. n. Lacinutrix lake feeder (in the sense of being basically important for the food chain)].
Gram-negative, straight or slightly curved rods, approximately 0·4–0·5 μm in width and 1–2 μm in length.
Do not form resting cells or spores.
Major fatty acids include i15 : 1ω10c, a15 : 1ω10c, i15 : 0, a15 : 0, br16 : 1 and i16 : 0.
A member of the family Flavobacteriaceae, class Flavobacteria, phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Lacinutrix copepodicola.
